cyclone.name: OPHELIA
cyclone.current_location: about 450 mi (725 km) south of Cape Hatteras, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: moving north, then north-northwest toward the North Carolina coast Friday night before sliding inland over eastern North Carolina and southeastern Virginia and emerging offshore of the Mid-Atlantic coast late Sunday-Monday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central or southern North Carolina coast (Surf City–Cape Lookout area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Surf City NC to Chincoteague VA, including Chesapeake Bay south of Smith Point and Albemarle & Pamlico Sounds
weather_observation.warning_coast: Cape Fear NC to Fenwick Island DE, including Chesapeake Bay south of Smith Point and Albemarle & Pamlico Sounds
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast and Mid-Atlantic coasts from South Carolina through Delaware, including Chesapeake Bay
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph with higher gusts) are expected to spread into the lower Chesapeake Bay and Hampton Roads area Friday night into Saturday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Water rises of 2–4 ft above ground level are possible in the lower Chesapeake Bay, including the Port of Virginia, if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain with localized amounts up to 6 inches could fall Friday through Sunday, producing urban and small-stream flooding near the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along the Virginia Beaches and possible minor coastal erosion.
